⊣ c2 =(SalGen ` c0)
⊣ d(hs0, c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, c2))
-| diffsw(hs0, wa(wceq(cuni(cv(hs1)), cuni(c0)), wss(c0, cv(hs1))))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(csalgen, c0))
-| diffsc(hs0, c0)

|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(csalgen, c0))
-| diffsc(hs0, c0)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0 ⊆ c2)
⊣ c2 =(SalGen ` c0)
⊣ d(hs0, c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(csalgen, c0))

comment: A set is a subset of the sigma-algebra it generates. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 3-Jan-2021.)
